content: This is a list of members of the [Parliament of Singapore](/wiki/Parliament_of_Singapore) who have been directly elected as representatives of an opposition party since (/wiki/1968_Singaporean_general_election), having secured victory in a [constituency](/wiki/Constituencies_of_Singapore). In [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore), the [People's Action Party](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party) (PAP) has governed continuously since (/wiki/1959_Singaporean_general_election), when [Singapore was a British colony](/wiki/Colony_of_Singapore), maintaining a [supermajority](/wiki/Supermajority) in Parliament. Consequently, the presence of opposition members has remained limited. Although Singapore became independent in (/wiki/Independence_of_Singapore_Agreement_1965), it was not until (/wiki/1981_Anson_by-election) that a non-PAP MP was directly elected in independent Singapore. The list excludes [non-constituency Members of Parliament](/wiki/Non-constituency_Member_of_Parliament) (NCMPs). [Group representation constituencies](/wiki/Group_representation_constituency) (GRCs) were introduced at the [1988 general election](/wiki/1988_Singaporean_general_election), while constituencies with a single [MP](/wiki/Parliament_of_Singapore#Members_of_Parliament) were renamed [single-member constituencies](/wiki/Single-member_district) (SMCs). However, it was not until 23 years later that an opposition party achieved victory in one. This milestone occurred in the [2011 general election](/wiki/2011_Singaporean_general_election), when the [Workers' Party](/wiki/Workers%27_Party_(Singapore)) (WP) won [Aljunied GRC](/wiki/Aljunied_Group_Representation_Constituency). The WP has remained the most prominent opposition force in Singaporean politics, with 19 distinct WP politicians having been directly elected to Parliament in post-independence Singapore. ## List This article is part of a series on[Politics of Singapore](/wiki/Politics_of_Singapore)[Constitution](/wiki/Constitution_of_Singapore) - title: List of Singapore opposition party MPs elected
